name: Erdős #28: Erdős-Turán Conjecture on Additive Bases
description: If A is an asymptotic basis of order 2 (A+A contains all large integers), then lim sup r_A(n) = ∞ where r_A(n) counts representations as a+b with a,b ∈ A.

insights: The Erdős-Turán conjecture (1941) is one of the most important open problems in additive combinatorics
$500 prize offered by Erdős for proof or disproof
Stronger form: lim sup r_A(n) / log(n) > 0
Grekos et al. (2003): proved r_A(n) ≥ 6 infinitely often for any asymptotic basis
Borwein et al.: improved to r_A(n) ≥ 8 infinitely often
Sidon sets (where a+b=c+d implies {a,b}={c,d}) have r_A(n) ≤ 2, but Sidon sets cannot be asymptotic bases
The conjecture is about whether bounded representation is possible for bases
